attributes.action: allow 16 and 17 year olds to vote in a 2nd EU Referendum
attributes.additional_details:
75% of 18-24 year olds voted IN
If we lowered that age to 16 there would be a higher percentage 
More people voting equals a fairer outcome 
A second referendum should be allowed so that the results can be compared
attributes.background: 16 and 17 year olds are the members of society who will be impacted the most by the older generation's votes, and they don't even have a voice.
